trans-unit.source: Common Patterns for Delegates
trans-unit.target: Common Patterns for Delegates

trans-unit.source: Previous
trans-unit.target: Previous

trans-unit.source: Delegates provide a mechanism that enables software designs involving minimal coupling between components.
trans-unit.target: Delegates provide a mechanism that enables software designs involving minimal coupling between components.

trans-unit.source: One excellent example for this kind of design is LINQ.
trans-unit.target: One excellent example for this kind of design is LINQ.

trans-unit.source: The LINQ Query Expression Pattern relies on delegates for all of its features.
trans-unit.target: The LINQ Query Expression Pattern relies on delegates for all of its features.

trans-unit.source: Consider this simple example:
trans-unit.target: Consider this simple example:

trans-unit.source: This filters the sequence of numbers to only those less than the value 10.
trans-unit.target: This filters the sequence of numbers to only those less than the value 10.

trans-unit.source: The `Where` method uses a delegate that determines which elements of a sequence pass the filter.
trans-unit.target: The `Where` method uses a delegate that determines which elements of a sequence pass the filter.

trans-unit.source: When you create a LINQ query, you supply the implementation of the delegate for this specific purpose.
trans-unit.target: When you create a LINQ query, you supply the implementation of the delegate for this specific purpose.

trans-unit.source: The prototype for the Where method is:
trans-unit.target: The prototype for the Where method is:

trans-unit.source: This example is repeated with all the methods that are part of LINQ.
trans-unit.target: This example is repeated with all the methods that are part of LINQ.

trans-unit.source: They all rely on delegates for the code that manages the specific query.
trans-unit.target: They all rely on delegates for the code that manages the specific query.

trans-unit.source: This API design pattern is a very powerful one to learn and understand.
trans-unit.target: This API design pattern is a very powerful one to learn and understand.

trans-unit.source: This simple example illustrates how delegates require very little coupling between components.
trans-unit.target: This simple example illustrates how delegates require very little coupling between components.

trans-unit.source: You don't need to create a class that derives from a particular base class.
trans-unit.target: You don't need to create a class that derives from a particular base class.

trans-unit.source: You don't need to implement a specific interface.
trans-unit.target: You don't need to implement a specific interface.

trans-unit.source: The only requirement is to provide the implementation of one method that is fundamental to the task at hand.
trans-unit.target: The only requirement is to provide the implementation of one method that is fundamental to the task at hand.

trans-unit.source: Building Your Own Components with Delegates
trans-unit.target: Building Your Own Components with Delegates

trans-unit.source: Let's build on that example by creating a component using a design that relies on delegates.
trans-unit.target: Let's build on that example by creating a component using a design that relies on delegates.

trans-unit.source: Let's define a component that could be used for log messages in a large system.
trans-unit.target: Let's define a component that could be used for log messages in a large system.

trans-unit.source: The library components could be used in many different environments, on multiple different platforms.
trans-unit.target: The library components could be used in many different environments, on multiple different platforms.

trans-unit.source: There are a lot of common features in the component that manages the logs.
trans-unit.target: There are a lot of common features in the component that manages the logs.

trans-unit.source: It will need to accept messages from any component in the system.
trans-unit.target: It will need to accept messages from any component in the system.

trans-unit.source: Those messages will have different priorities, which the core component can manage.
trans-unit.target: Those messages will have different priorities, which the core component can manage.

trans-unit.source: The messages should have timestamps in their final archived form.
trans-unit.target: The messages should have timestamps in their final archived form.

trans-unit.source: For more advanced scenarios, you could filter messages by the source component.
trans-unit.target: For more advanced scenarios, you could filter messages by the source component.

trans-unit.source: There is one aspect of the feature that will change often: where messages are written.
trans-unit.target: There is one aspect of the feature that will change often: where messages are written.

trans-unit.source: In some environments, they may be written to the error console.
trans-unit.target: In some environments, they may be written to the error console.

trans-unit.source: In others, a file.
trans-unit.target: In others, a file.

trans-unit.source: Other possibilities include database storage, OS event logs, or other document storage.
trans-unit.target: Other possibilities include database storage, OS event logs, or other document storage.

trans-unit.source: There are also combinations of output that might be used in different scenarios.
trans-unit.target: There are also combinations of output that might be used in different scenarios.

trans-unit.source: You may want to write messages to the console and to a file.
trans-unit.target: You may want to write messages to the console and to a file.

trans-unit.source: A design based on delegates will provide a great deal of flexibility, and make it easy to support storage mechanisms that may be added in the future.
trans-unit.target: A design based on delegates will provide a great deal of flexibility, and make it easy to support storage mechanisms that may be added in the future.

trans-unit.source: Under this design, the primary log component can be a non-virtual, even sealed class.
trans-unit.target: Under this design, the primary log component can be a non-virtual, even sealed class.

trans-unit.source: You can plug in any set of delegates to write the messages to different storage media.
trans-unit.target: You can plug in any set of delegates to write the messages to different storage media.

trans-unit.source: The built in support for multicast delegates makes it easy to support scenarios where messages must be written to multiple locations (a file, and a console).
trans-unit.target: The built in support for multicast delegates makes it easy to support scenarios where messages must be written to multiple locations (a file, and a console).

trans-unit.source: A First Implementation
trans-unit.target: A First Implementation

trans-unit.source: Let's start small: the initial implementation will accept new messages, and write them using any attached delegate.
trans-unit.target: Let's start small: the initial implementation will accept new messages, and write them using any attached delegate.

trans-unit.source: You can start with one delegate that writes messages to the console.
trans-unit.target: You can start with one delegate that writes messages to the console.

trans-unit.source: The static class above is the simplest thing that can work.
trans-unit.target: The static class above is the simplest thing that can work.

trans-unit.source: Practices
trans-unit.target: Practices

trans-unit.source: Our sample so far is fairly simple, but it still demonstrates some of the important guidelines for designs involving delegates.
trans-unit.target: Our sample so far is fairly simple, but it still demonstrates some of the important guidelines for designs involving delegates.

trans-unit.source: Using the delegate types defined in the Core Framework makes it easier for users to work with the delegates.
trans-unit.target: Using the delegate types defined in the Core Framework makes it easier for users to work with the delegates.

trans-unit.source: You don't need to define new types, and developers using your library do not need to learn new, specialized delegate types.
trans-unit.target: You don't need to define new types, and developers using your library do not need to learn new, specialized delegate types.

trans-unit.source: The interfaces used are as minimal and as flexible as possible: To create a new output logger, you must create one method.
trans-unit.target: The interfaces used are as minimal and as flexible as possible: To create a new output logger, you must create one method.

trans-unit.source: That method may be a static method, or an instance method.
trans-unit.target: That method may be a static method, or an instance method.

trans-unit.source: It may have any access.
trans-unit.target: It may have any access.

trans-unit.source: Formatting Output
trans-unit.target: Formatting Output

trans-unit.source: Let's make this first version a bit more robust, and then start creating other logging mechanisms.
trans-unit.target: Let's make this first version a bit more robust, and then start creating other logging mechanisms.

trans-unit.source: Next, let's add a few arguments to the `LogMessage()` method so that your log class creates more structured messages:
trans-unit.target: Next, let's add a few arguments to the `LogMessage()` method so that your log class creates more structured messages:

trans-unit.source: Next, let's make use of that `Severity` argument to filter the messages that are sent to the log's output.
trans-unit.target: Next, let's make use of that `Severity` argument to filter the messages that are sent to the log's output.

trans-unit.source: Practices
trans-unit.target: Practices

trans-unit.source: You've added new features to the logging infrastructure.
trans-unit.target: You've added new features to the logging infrastructure.

trans-unit.source: Because the logger component is very loosely coupled to any output mechanism, these new features can be added with no impact on any of the code implementing the logger delegate.
trans-unit.target: Because the logger component is very loosely coupled to any output mechanism, these new features can be added with no impact on any of the code implementing the logger delegate.

trans-unit.source: As you keep building this, you'll see more examples of how this loose coupling enables greater flexibility in updating parts of the site without any changes to other locations.
trans-unit.target: As you keep building this, you'll see more examples of how this loose coupling enables greater flexibility in updating parts of the site without any changes to other locations.

trans-unit.source: In fact, in a larger application, the logger output classes might be in a different assembly, and not even need to be rebuilt.
trans-unit.target: In fact, in a larger application, the logger output classes might be in a different assembly, and not even need to be rebuilt.

trans-unit.source: Building a Second Output Engine
trans-unit.target: Building a Second Output Engine

trans-unit.source: The Log component is coming along well.
trans-unit.target: The Log component is coming along well.

trans-unit.source: Let's add one more output engine that logs messages to a file.
trans-unit.target: Let's add one more output engine that logs messages to a file.

trans-unit.source: This will be a slightly more involved output engine.
trans-unit.target: This will be a slightly more involved output engine.

trans-unit.source: It will be a class that encapsulates the file operations, and ensures that the file is always closed after each write.
trans-unit.target: It will be a class that encapsulates the file operations, and ensures that the file is always closed after each write.

trans-unit.source: That ensures that all the data is flushed to disk after each message is generated.
trans-unit.target: That ensures that all the data is flushed to disk after each message is generated.

trans-unit.source: Here is that file based logger:
trans-unit.target: Here is that file based logger:

trans-unit.source: These two are not mutually exclusive.
trans-unit.target: These two are not mutually exclusive.

trans-unit.target: You could attach both log methods and generate messages to the console and a file:

trans-unit.source: Practices
trans-unit.target: Practices

trans-unit.source: Now, you've added a second output handler for the logging sub-system.
trans-unit.target: Now, you've added a second output handler for the logging sub-system.

trans-unit.source: This one needs a bit more infrastructure to correctly support the file system.
trans-unit.target: This one needs a bit more infrastructure to correctly support the file system.

trans-unit.source: The delegate is an instance method.
trans-unit.target: The delegate is an instance method.

trans-unit.source: It's also a private method.
trans-unit.target: It's also a private method.

trans-unit.source: There's no need for greater accessibility because the delegate infrastructure can connect the delegates.
trans-unit.target: There's no need for greater accessibility because the delegate infrastructure can connect the delegates.

trans-unit.source: Second, the delegate-based design enables multiple output methods without any extra code.
trans-unit.target: Second, the delegate-based design enables multiple output methods without any extra code.

trans-unit.source: You don't need to build any additional infrastructure to support multiple output methods.
trans-unit.target: You don't need to build any additional infrastructure to support multiple output methods.

trans-unit.source: They simply become another method on the invocation list.
trans-unit.target: They simply become another method on the invocation list.

trans-unit.source: Pay special attention to the code in the file logging output method.
trans-unit.target: Pay special attention to the code in the file logging output method.

trans-unit.source: It is coded to ensure that it does not throw any exceptions.
trans-unit.target: It is coded to ensure that it does not throw any exceptions.

trans-unit.source: While this isn't always strictly necessary, it's often a good practice.
trans-unit.target: While this isn't always strictly necessary, it's often a good practice.

trans-unit.source: If either of the delegate methods throws an exception, the remaining delegates that are on the invocation won't be invoked.
trans-unit.target: If either of the delegate methods throws an exception, the remaining delegates that are on the invocation won't be invoked.

trans-unit.source: As a last note, the file logger must manage its resources by opening and closing the file on each log message.
trans-unit.target: As a last note, the file logger must manage its resources by opening and closing the file on each log message.

trans-unit.source: You could choose to keep the file open and implement IDisposable to close the file when you are completed.
trans-unit.target: You could choose to keep the file open and implement IDisposable to close the file when you are completed.

trans-unit.source: Either method has its advantages and disadvantages.
trans-unit.target: Either method has its advantages and disadvantages.

trans-unit.source: Both do create a bit more coupling between the classes.
trans-unit.target: Both do create a bit more coupling between the classes.

trans-unit.source: None of the code in the Logger class would need to be updated in order to support either scenario.
trans-unit.target: None of the code in the Logger class would need to be updated in order to support either scenario.

trans-unit.source: Handling Null Delegates
trans-unit.target: Handling Null Delegates

trans-unit.source: Finally, let's update the LogMessage method so that it is robust for those cases when no output mechanism is selected.
trans-unit.target: Finally, let's update the LogMessage method so that it is robust for those cases when no output mechanism is selected.

trans-unit.source: The current implementation will throw a `NullReferenceException` when the `WriteMessage` delegate does not have an invocation list attached.
trans-unit.target: The current implementation will throw a `NullReferenceException` when the `WriteMessage` delegate does not have an invocation list attached.

trans-unit.source: You may prefer a design that silently continues when no methods have been attached.
trans-unit.target: You may prefer a design that silently continues when no methods have been attached.

trans-unit.source: This is easy using the null conditional operator, combined with the `Delegate.Invoke()` method:
trans-unit.target: This is easy using the null conditional operator, combined with the `Delegate.Invoke()` method:

trans-unit.source: The null conditional operator (`?.`) short-circuits when the left operand (`WriteMessage` in this case) is null, which means no attempt is made to log a message.
trans-unit.target: The null conditional operator (`?.`) short-circuits when the left operand (`WriteMessage` in this case) is null, which means no attempt is made to log a message.

trans-unit.source: You won't find the `Invoke()` method listed in the documentation for `System.Delegate` or `System.MulticastDelegate`.
trans-unit.target: You won't find the `Invoke()` method listed in the documentation for `System.Delegate` or `System.MulticastDelegate`.

trans-unit.source: The compiler generates a type safe `Invoke` method for any delegate type declared.
trans-unit.target: The compiler generates a type safe `Invoke` method for any delegate type declared.

trans-unit.source: In this example, that means `Invoke` takes a single `string` argument, and has a void return type.
trans-unit.target: In this example, that means `Invoke` takes a single `string` argument, and has a void return type.

trans-unit.source: Summary of Practices
trans-unit.target: Summary of Practices

trans-unit.source: You've seen the beginnings of a log component that could be expanded with other writers, and other features.
trans-unit.target: You've seen the beginnings of a log component that could be expanded with other writers, and other features.

trans-unit.source: By using delegates in the design these different components are very loosely coupled.
trans-unit.target: By using delegates in the design these different components are very loosely coupled.

trans-unit.source: This provides several advantages.
trans-unit.target: This provides several advantages.

trans-unit.source: It's very easy to create new output mechanisms and attach them to the system.
trans-unit.target: It's very easy to create new output mechanisms and attach them to the system.

trans-unit.source: These other mechanisms only need one method: the method that writes the log message.
trans-unit.target: These other mechanisms only need one method: the method that writes the log message.

trans-unit.source: It's a design that is very resilient when new features are added.
trans-unit.target: It's a design that is very resilient when new features are added.

trans-unit.source: The contract required for any writer is to implement one method.
trans-unit.target: The contract required for any writer is to implement one method.

trans-unit.source: That method could be a static or instance method.
trans-unit.target: That method could be a static or instance method.

trans-unit.source: It could be public, private, or any other legal access.
trans-unit.target: It could be public, private, or any other legal access.

trans-unit.source: The Logger class can make any number of enhancements or changes without introducing breaking changes.
trans-unit.target: The Logger class can make any number of enhancements or changes without introducing breaking changes.

trans-unit.source: Like any class, you cannot modify the public API without the risk of breaking changes.
trans-unit.target: Like any class, you cannot modify the public API without the risk of breaking changes.

trans-unit.source: But, because the coupling between the logger and any output engines is only through the delegate, no other types (like interfaces or base classes) are involved.
trans-unit.target: But, because the coupling between the logger and any output engines is only through the delegate, no other types (like interfaces or base classes) are involved.

trans-unit.source: The coupling is as small as possible.
trans-unit.target: The coupling is as small as possible.
